column4: Can I ask a question about Nautilus? or should I go somewhere else?
It just quit unexpectedly
It's becoming expected at this point.
thunar?
Oh. Okay. Wait, is there a way to manage files without that? Like, via the terminal?
Lots of people use bash as their file manager
.....I was saying that, having read that exact botscript, that I felt bad for crashing something that itself crashes systems. That makes me like, extra-clumsy.

You start by checking the repos for apps you want. If they aren't there, you can look around for a .deb package made for Ubuntu. If that doesn't help, you can download and compile apps. Most source tarballs will include a README or INSTALL file.. you should read those first.
My system is being lame and crashing whenever I do arbitrary things. Besides, I've already downloaded the stupid tar.gz :p
Which app is it?
Adobe Reader 7.0, I think
Enable the multiverse repo, then: sudo apt-get install acroread
It's in the repos :)
But I already downloaded it. it's 40meg. That's painful to have to re-do on a 56k dial-up connection. ;_;
Your call
Not really. What's the problem with just compiling it from the tarball, anyway?

Well, I always install from the repos first, it ensures the stability of your syste. You can compile it I suppose, but you will have to do updates manually, this may mean downloading large tarballs and re-compiling in the future.
You will also have to do deps resolving manually if you compile
Aaah. Well, stability is something I'm lacking in obscene amounts. ;_; So I'll just apt-get it. Thanks for the explanation
You're welcome :)
I'll beat you to it: https://help.ubuntu.com/community/Repositories
Thanks again
